intro: Oxytropis sibajensis, commonly known as the Sibajinskaya oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis sibajensis is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows and steppe regions.
